 11#define VSIP_CSL_STENCIL_EXPR_HPP

 19#include <cassert>

 25namespace vsip_csl

 27namespace stencil

 29
 30// Different sub-expressions we need to recognize:
 31//
 32//  o offset (I + 1)
 33//  o call (image(I))
 34//  o binary (2 * image(I))
 35
 36template <typename T> struct Is_expr { static bool const value = false;};
 37
 38template <vsip::dimension_type D>
 39struct Iterator {};
 40
 41template <vsip::dimension_type D>
 42struct Offset
 43{
 44  Offset(vsip::stride_type ii) : i(ii) {}
 45  vsip::stride_type i;
 46};
 47
 48template <typename V, typename I, typename J> struct Call;
 49
 50template <typename V, typename I, typename J>
 51struct Is_expr<Call<V, I, J> > { static bool const value = true;};
 52
 53template <typename V, typename I, typename J, typename RHS>
 54void assign(Call<V, I, J> lhs, RHS rhs);
 55
 56template <typename V, typename I, typename J>
 57class Call
 58{
 59public:
 60  typedef V view_type;
 61
 62  Call(V v, I i, J j) : view_(v), i_(i), j_(j) {}
 63  view_type view() { return view_;}
 64  I i() { return i_;}
 65  J j() { return j_;}
 66
 67private:
 68  view_type view_;
 69  I i_;
 70  J j_;
 71};
 72
 73template <typename V>
 74class Call<V, Iterator<0>, Iterator<1> >
 75{
 76public:
 77  typedef V view_type;
 78
 79  Call(V v, Iterator<0>, Iterator<1>) : view_(v) {}
 80  template <typename RHS>
 81  void operator= (RHS rhs) { assign(*this, rhs);}
 82  view_type view() { return view_;}
 83  Iterator<0> i() { return Iterator<0>();}
 84  Iterator<1> j() { return Iterator<1>();}
 85
 86private:
 87  view_type view_;
 88};
 89
 90template <vsip::dimension_type D>
 91Offset<D> operator+ (Iterator<D>, vsip::stride_type i)
 92{
 93  return Offset<D>(i);
 94}
 95
 96template <vsip::dimension_type D>
 97Offset<D> operator- (Iterator<D>, vsip::stride_type i)
 98{
 99  return Offset<D>(-i);
100}
101
102// Generic binary expression
103template <typename L, typename R, template <typename, typename> class O>
104class Binary_expr
105{
106public:
107  typedef typename L::view_type view_type;
108
109  Binary_expr(L l, R r) : left_(l), right_(r) {}
110
111  view_type view() { return left_.view();}
112  L left() { return left_;}
113  R right() { return right_;}
114
115private:
116  L left_;
117  R right_;
118};
119
120template <typename L, typename R, template <typename, typename> class O>
121struct Is_expr<Binary_expr<L, R, O> > { static bool const value = true;};
122
123// Binary expression: the left operand is an expression, the right a scalar.
124// This is valid only for O in (Mult, Div)
125template <typename L, typename R, template <typename, typename> class O,
126          typename S>
127class Binary_expr<Binary_expr<L, R, O>, S, expr::op::Mult>
128{
129public:
130  typedef typename Binary_expr<L, R, O>::view_type view_type;
131
132  Binary_expr(Binary_expr<L, R, O> e, S s) : left_(e), right_(s) {}
133  view_type view() { return left_.view();}
134  Binary_expr<L, R, O> left() { return left_;}
135  S right() { return right_;}
136
137private:
138  Binary_expr<L, R, O> left_;
139  S right_;
140};
141
142template <typename L, typename R, template <typename, typename> class O,
143          typename S>
144class Binary_expr<Binary_expr<L, R, O>, S, expr::op::Div>
145{
146public:
147  typedef typename Binary_expr<L, R, O>::view_type view_type;
148
149  Binary_expr(Binary_expr<L, R, O> e, S s) : left_(e), right_(s) {}
150  view_type view() { return right_.view();}
151  Binary_expr<L, R, O> left() { return left_;}
152  S right() { return right_;}
153
154private:
155  Binary_expr<L, R, O> left_;
156  S right_;
157};
158
159// Binary expression: the left operand is a scalar, the right an expression.
160// This is valid only for O == Mult.
161template <typename S,
162          typename L, typename R, template <typename, typename> class O>
163class Binary_expr<S, Binary_expr<L, R, O>, expr::op::Mult>
164{
165public:
166  typedef typename Binary_expr<L, R, O>::view_type view_type;
167
168  Binary_expr(S s, Binary_expr<L, R, O> e) : left_(s), right_(e) {}
169  view_type view() { return right_.view();}
170  S left() { return left_;}
171  Binary_expr<L, R, O> right() { return right_;}
172
173private:
174  S left_;
175  Binary_expr<L, R, O> right_;
176};
177
178// Binary expression: the left operand is a call, the right a scalar.
179// This is valid only for O in (Mult, Div)
180template <typename V, typename I, typename J, typename S>
181class Binary_expr<Call<V, I, J>, S, expr::op::Mult>
182{
183public:
184  typedef V view_type;
185
186  Binary_expr(Call<V, I, J> c, S s) : left_(c), right_(s) {}
187  view_type view() { return left_.view();}
188  Call<V, I, J> left() { return left_;}
189  S right() { return right_;}
190
191private:
192  Call<V, I, J> left_;
193  S right_;
194};
195
196template <typename V, typename I, typename J, typename S>
197class Binary_expr<Call<V, I, J>, S, expr::op::Div>
198{
199public:
200  typedef V view_type;
201
202  Binary_expr(Call<V, I, J> c, S s) : left_(c), right_(s) {}
203  view_type view() { return left_.view();}
204  Call<V, I, J> left() { return left_;}
205  S right() { return right_;}
206
207private:
208  Call<V, I, J> left_;
209  S right_;
210};
211
212// Binary expression: the left operand is a scalar, the right a call.
213// This is valid only for O == Mult.
214template <typename S, typename V, typename I, typename J>
215class Binary_expr<S, Call<V, I, J>, expr::op::Mult>
216{
217public:
218  typedef V view_type;
219
220  Binary_expr(S s, Call<V, I, J> c) : left_(s), right_(c) {}
221  view_type view() { return right_.view();}
222  S left() { return left_;}
223  Call<V, I, J> right() { return right_;}
224
225private:
226  S left_;
227  Call<V, I, J> right_;
228};
229
230template <typename L, typename R>
231typename vsip::impl::Type_if<Binary_expr<L, R, expr::op::Add>, 
232                             Is_expr<L>::value || Is_expr<R>::value>::type
233operator+ (L l, R r)
234{
235  return Binary_expr<L, R, expr::op::Add>(l, r);
236}
237
238template <typename L, typename R>
239typename vsip::impl::Type_if<Binary_expr<L, R, expr::op::Sub>,
240                             Is_expr<L>::value || Is_expr<R>::value>::type
241operator- (L l, R r)
242{
243  return Binary_expr<L, R, expr::op::Sub>(l, r);
244}
245
246template <typename L, typename R>
247typename vsip::impl::Type_if<Binary_expr<L, R, expr::op::Mult>,
248                             Is_expr<L>::value || Is_expr<R>::value>::type
249operator* (L l, R r)
250{
251  return Binary_expr<L, R, expr::op::Mult>(l, r);
252}
253
254template <typename L, typename R>
255typename vsip::impl::Type_if<Binary_expr<L, R, expr::op::Div>,
256                             Is_expr<L>::value || Is_expr<R>::value>::type
257operator/ (L l, R r)
258{
259  return Binary_expr<L, R, expr::op::Div>(l, r);
260}
